page.title: 04Landscape
page.content: This is dependant on the type of farming + the way its is carried out. At the NW, bordering Trenley Park Woods has areas of pasture + cereal crops interspersed with patches of woodland. Wild flowers are allowed to grow along verges and hedgerows- Cow Parsely, Wild roses, Clematis, Honeysuckle, Wood anemones, Bluebells and Campions. The orchards are beautiful in blossom time. Many footpaths are confined between fences but trees have been planted for shelter. An area of Pine Wood has been replaced by orchard with a fringe by the main road. By the river some of the old water meadows remain, at Seaton, L'bourne Mill + Garrington. Towards Ickham it is more arable + flat, hedges and trees have suffered from stubble burning. The old gravel pits are being recovered for wildlife.
